      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object invoke(Object proxy, Method method, Object[] argv)
      Subclasses may declare methods with the same signature of a proxied interface method which will be invoked (as a sort of listener) before invoking the target method.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public Object invoke(Object proxy,
                     Method method,
                     Object[] argv)
              throws Throwable
        Subclasses may declare methods with the same signature of a proxied interface method which will be invoked (as a sort of listener) before invoking the target method. If the invoked Method's declaring class is assignable from the target's class, the Method is invoked on the target.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface DefaultInterfaceMethodInvocationHandler
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface InvocationHandler
        Overrides:
        invoke in class DefaultInvocationHandler
        Parameters:
        proxy - The proxy instance.
        method - The Method.
        argv - The argument array.
        Returns:
        The value to return from the Method invocation.
        Throws:
        Exception - If the Method cannot be invoked.
        Throwable
